query: Three microphones $A, B$ and $C$ are placed on a line such that $A$ is $1 \mathrm{~km}$ west of $B$ and $C$ is $2 \mathrm{~km}$ east of $B$. A large explosion occurs at a point $P$ not on this line. Each of the three microphones receives the sound. The sound travels at $\frac{1}{3} \mathrm{~km} / \mathrm{s}$. Microphone $B$ receives the sound first, microphone $A$ receives the sound $\frac{1}{2}$ s later, and microphone $C$ receives it $1 \mathrm{~s}$ after microphone $A$. Determine the distance from microphone $B$ to the explosion at $P$.
